docs.text: Gitea for PHP Gitea client library, in PHP . Quick start Install the latest version of Gitea for PHP with Composer : composer require sab-international/gitea For detailed instructions, see the installation guide .
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: Install the latest version of Gitea for PHP with Composer : composer require sab-international/gitea For detailed instructions, see the installation guide .
docs.title: Quick start

docs.text: Installation Requirements Before installing Gitea for PHP , you need to make sure you have PHP and Composer , the PHP package manager, up and running. Warning Gitea for PHP requires PHP = 7.2.0 . You can verify if you're already good to go with the following commands: php --version # PHP 7.2.10-0ubuntu1 (cli) (built: Sep 13 2018 13:38:55) ( NTS ) composer --version # Composer version 1.7.3 2018-11-01 10:05:06 Info If you plan to play with the package sources, you will also need Robo and Material for MkDocs . Installing with Composer package manager 1. Install it From a command prompt, run: composer require sab-international/gitea 2. Import it Now in your PHP code, you can use: ?php use Gitea\ { Repository , Team , User };
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: Changelog Version 0.2.0 Added __toString() methods to the model classes. Added the TrackedTime model. Added a user guide based on MkDocs . Updated the package dependencies. Version 0.1.1 Fixed issue #1 : the PushEvent::jsonSerialize() method returns "TODO" strings. Version 0.1.0 Initial release.
docs.title: Changelog

docs.text: Added __toString() methods to the model classes. Added the TrackedTime model. Added a user guide based on MkDocs . Updated the package dependencies.
docs.title: Version 0.2.0

docs.text: Fixed issue #1 : the PushEvent::jsonSerialize() method returns "TODO" strings.
